transcription.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
So hi, guys.
It's absolutely a pleasure to be here in our annual festival.
Ethereum festival, we have it once a year, and it's great.
It's a total joy.
And yeah, I have 20 minutes.
I have 20 minutes to tell you what either
can have been doing this year and what
we're planning for you for next month,
but you're going to see.
A lot of stuff, I go briefly.
And if you want more details, you always welcome to come
and chat with us.
But I want to start with really say thank you.
I want to start with say thank you
because if we're thinking about roadmaps, planning
features, building strategy, we are very simple on that.
We just have you, and you tell us what to do.
So if you are not yet on our Slack, please join this.
It's either.camp and ask us to build something
or integrate something, and we really will do it for you.
Let's talk about our products.
And the most famous products is absolutely Ethereum Studio.
We promised it last year.
Last year, a year ago, we actually
promised to use this product.
We promised to put one button on the website.
You click it, and you get a desktop experience.
Very easy.
We built in Ethereum Sandbox.
All the features of Ethereum, you can build projects.
You can do GitHub.
You can do command line.
You can do everything.
And special thank for our friends in Microsoft Azure,
who provides us with servers, and let
us to bring all this experience for you for free.
So what is the future of this product?
First of all, this year was amazing for me.
I had a chance to travel the world
and actually see classrooms of people, hackatons, academy,
conferences, both.
Actually doing Ethereum with Ethereum Studio.
And I have to say, there is nothing more
satisfying in this business than actually
see developers working with you too.
Like it's better than everything.
And if it works, it's great.
Like you actually see people using this and building something.
It's total joy.
And I have to say, we have absolutely
great response from academy to using Ethereum
and to using this too.
And we're so close.
We're so close to see them including Ethereum
into real computer science program.
For now, they're just doing workshops and playing with this.
And we do it with students.
And I really enjoy this.
But they really want to see smart contract solidity go
into the real program.
And they are preparing for this.
So hopefully, wait for announcements soon.
And by the way, special thanks for validity labs, which
are great educational in Europe.
And if you're looking for great educator about Ethereum,
just Google validity labs, they are really awesome.
And they will go and do courses for you.
So this is our first features that we are going to release in week
or so.
It's a full functional debugger.
I think there is no such a thing as debugger for solidity
that's been asked by all our community.
Like people totally ask us for all this year.
You should build it.
And you're going to have it.
You're going to see transparency on all the variables,
call stack, function parameters, they all think.
So I hope it will make your development shorter, maybe 90%.
It's the real thing.
And it was our main focus in last month.
We really took everything out and focused on this thing.
And it's almost ready.
It's repolishing this.
It's going to be for you in the same studio using today.
Let's talk a little bit about continuous integration.
Continuous integration in Ethereum
is not just like an usual software.
It's not just something that keeps bugs out of your code.
No.
It's a real contract.
It's something that actually says what this smart contract does.
And sometimes it can cost money.
And it can mean a lot of money.
Like, for example, $150 million.
This is why we spent also some time
to figure out how it should be done properly.
And what we done, we actually took a sandbox of Ethereum Studio,
took it out, what programmers called Headless,
without a UI.
And we provided it as a sandbox for a command line.
So basically, in very regular JavaScript testing tools,
you can have a very nice and very clear testing,
continuous integration environments.
And basically, what I believe is going to happen--
and it kind of going this direction--
that all the white papers around smart contracts,
all the meaningful white papers that
deals with money and real contracts,
they are going to have links to real unit testing
of solidity.
Because this is the only way to prove
that what you put in your white paper and then in the code,
actually do the same thing.
Because and people are going to watch this.
It's going to be as common as white papers.
People in Enterprise was asking us to use Ethereum Studio.
It's kind of hard for them to use live networks.
So we work with Microsoft.
And it's already a radio on a marketplace.
It's going to be on marketplace in probably a couple of days.
We tested it, and they validated that everything
could work properly.
You're going to have the Ethereum Studio inside your companies
that run in Microsoft Azure.
And you're going to have it inside the marketplace.
OK, next one, Ethereum J.
Ethereum J, the infrastructure that we run Ethereum with.
Together with Go and Rask, this is what
running our live network.
This is what we have.
So the community around Ethereum J has very nice way
to go different directions.
And it was a pleasure to support them in all different ways.

working on us on different levels, sometimes formally,
and doing really great things, because we really provide
this library for customization and take it and do whatever
you want on Ethereum, with Ethereum, behind Ethereum.

fraction of them, but the guys that I can't tell about.
So Deloitte really announced a great identity project

They've been really busy showing everybody
about this identity project.
Very, very interesting, because Deloitte really
knows how identity works.
And they took our Java and built identity project
on top of this.
And you should check it.
You should check it if you're looking for good blockchain-based
identity project.
You probably read about climatics.
They're doing something very cool.
They're doing settlements between banks.

And they're doing this communication
between finance institutions for settlement.
Yeah, settlement cons.
Gemini, they exchange for in New York, a big legal exchange,
compliant, and doing Ethereum trading with all the other
currencies, with dollars also.
It's a bank.
They're running Ethereum J for different connections
and have very nice cold storage solution, also using
the same library.
Trippiller Global is customizing stuff.
They're doing different projects globally.
They're also in good connection with us
and customize the library according to the order.
Santon there.
Great guys.
So in a minute, I will tell you what we're doing with Santon

Rootstock, smart contracts on Bitcoin.
You've probably heard about this.
What is Rootstock?
It's nice a startup in Argentina.
And they really want, they're so excited about smart contracts
on Ethereum and they want to bring it to Bitcoin,
just to Bitcoin that we know.
And what they have, they have the Bitcoin blockchain
as we know it.
And they took our Java implementation as it is,
as it runs Ethereum.
And they run it as a side chain to the Bitcoin blockchain.
So they have talking inside this and basically they can run.
It's the same virtual machine for now.
They have some plans and we're talking to them about how they're
going to develop in the future.
But now they just run in the same Ethereum as a side chain.
So what it gives us, it gives us really great opportunity.
You can take the same Ethereum studio, the same smart contracts
that you have today and basically have them in Bitcoin environment.
It should be cool, right?
Thank you.

and get this money tokenized on smart contract running on live Ethereum blockchain.

and another account that has tokens which are backed by real money
in reserve inside bundle, the Santander.
And these tokens are fast and support all the standards of Ethereum tokens, right?
So this gives us the agility to build really, really cool features on top of it.

You just give your brain wallet signature, which is a private key,
and you approve it and you basically pay with this balance that you tokenize.
